New Records: The Dodgers have gone 33 postseason innings without allowing a single run, matching an MLB postseason record set by the Baltimore Orioles in the 1966 World Series.
Key Match Events: Jack Flaherty pitched seven scoreless innings and allowed just two hits while striking out six in his start on Sunday.
The Dodgers added three more runs in the bottom of the eighth inning when Mookie Betts hit a double, remarkably the only extra-base hit of the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers now have a 1-0 series lead heading into Mondayâ€™s Game 2 and are just three wins away from reaching their first World Series since 2020.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Dodger Stadium.
Others: The Dodgers' offense was solid once again, with Max Muncy, Shohei Ohtani, Tommy Edman, and Freddie Freeman contributing RBIs.
